 Candidate   Kirsty Boytler  
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
 
Location:   United Arab Emirates – Dubai  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
MSc International Human Resource Management - Manchester Metropolitan University, 2019 -2021  
B.A. (Hons) Degree Business Management 2:1 Upper Class - University of Paisley, 2003  
 
Chartered Institute Personnel and Development, 2018, Associate CIPD Diploma Level 5  
PwC Academy, CIPD Human Resources Business Partner, April 2017  
Clariden, Handling Employment Disputes, Termination and Dismissal for Locals and Expats, June 2014  
 
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
Sep 2020 to Present IHS Towers  
Position: Associate Director, HR (Senior Regional Human Resources Business Partner) MENA  
IHS Towers is the largest mobile telecommunications infrastructu re provider in Africa, Europe and the 
Middle East.  
• Reporting line Global Group HR Director (Nigeria) and CHRO (London) – most senior HR 
professional for MENA region. Direct re ports, HRPBs, TA team, HR Admin team (7 in total).  
• Responsible for HR SOX compliance with external auditors (PWC & Deloitte) and point for 
internal HR audit reviews.  
• Lead Talent Development & Organisational Learning, foster a Training and Coaching cult ure. 
Recent TD projects include Development Programs, Competency Frameworks and Internal 
Mobility.  
• Total Rewards control for MENA region (UAE, Egypt & Kuwait), review annual salaries, 
benchmarking (Mercer) internal and external positions, responsible for  promotion and annual 
increment decisions for MENA region, bonus calculation and processing. Total reward 
alignment with role grading (Mercer IPE), job titling, job descriptions.  
• Run HR headcount budget with business unit heads, workforce planning, relea se and hire roles 
in line with budget within rewards framework.  
• Lead HR Operations Management in line with regional labour laws. Monthly payroll 
management, HC reporting, Performance Management, HR Analytics, proactively identify 
issues to improve employ ee relations, establish best HR practices. Focused on reviewing & 
revamping HR and operational processes that contribute to high performing organisation.  
• Create and implement Employee Engagement Strategy (Engagement Surveys, Analysing 
Results & Roll out initiatives to improve engagement).  
• Develop strong trusting relationships with stakeholders to gain support and achieve results. 
Effectively envision, develop, and implement new strategies and operations to address 
competitive, complex business issues.  
 
 Jan 2016  to Jun 2019 Al Tayer Group, Retail, Dubai , UAE  
Position: Regional Senior Human Resources Business Partner (GCC)  
Al Tayer Group is a holding company operating across the Middle East with over 200 stores.  
• Reported to Chief HR Officer (CHRO), senior advisor t o Senior Vice President (SVP).  
• Responsible for AED 100m+ headcount budget & oversaw total rewards  
• Oversaw successful Emiratization, Saudization, Kuwaitisation, Qatarization and Bahrainisation  
• Led Performance Management including performance improveme nt agenda and annual 
appraisal cycle, reshaped resourcing and performance management to support business shift 
from bricks and mortar to online  
• Created Leadership Development and Succession Planning Programs  
• Developed Employee Engagement Strategies in line with Business Objectives  
 
2012  to 2016 Shelf Drilling Offshore Holdings Ltd. Dubai , UAE  
Position: Human Resources  Manager  
Shelf Drilling is the world’s largest contractor of jack -up rigs in Southeast Asia, India, West Africa and 
Middle East, North Africa & Mediterranean.  
• Reporting to Human Resources Manager and Vice President Human Resources.  
• Worked with stakeholders in Southeast Asia, India, West Africa and MENA, providing guidance 
to business leaders on all HR related activities  
• Developed International Gro up Talent Development and Talent Acquisition programs & oversaw 
visa department.  
• Created content and facilitated training courses for Senior Managers, new hires and HR 
professionals.  
 
2011 to 2012 Skilled International. Dubai , UAE  
Position: Managing Consultant  
• Develop and execute recruitment plans for executive lev

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
